title: How to Make Lemon Pie

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and put the crumbs in a bowl.
steps.description: Get out a mixing bowl and pour 1 1/2 cups (180 g) of graham cracker crumbs into it. If you're crushing your own graham cracker crumbs, you'll need to pulse 11 to 12 full graham cracker sheets in a food processor.Tip: If you'd like a slighty nutty crust, substitute 1/2 cup (60 g) of the crumbs with 1/2 cup (60 g) of ground, toasted almonds.

steps.headline: Stir granulated sugar and melted butter into the crumbs.
steps.description: Melt 5 tablespoons (70 g) of butter and pour it into the bowl with the graham cracker crumbs. Add 1/3 cup (65 grams) of granulated sugar and stir until the mixture is combined. The crust mixture should be sandy and moist.

steps.headline: Press the crust into a pie plate.
steps.description: Set a 9 in (23 cm) pie plate on your work surface and scoop the crust mixture into it. Use your fingers or the bottom of a measuring cup to push the crumbs evenly across the bottom and sides of the plate. Press the crumb mixture firmly to form an even crust. The crust should be ⁄4 to ⁄2 inch (0.64 to 1.27 cm) thick.

steps.headline: Bake the graham cracker crust for 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Put the crust into the preheated oven and bake it until it becomes lightly golden brown. It should also smell fragrant and toasted. Then remove the crust and set it on a rack to cool. Prepare the filling while the crust cools. Keep the oven heated to 350 °F (177 °C).

steps.headline: Squeeze 5 to 6 lemons.
steps.description: Cut each lemon in half and use a juicer or citrus press to squeeze the juice into a bowl or measuring jug. Keep juicing lemons until you have 1 cup (240 ml) of fresh juice. While you can use bottled juice, it won't be as flavorful or tart as fresh juice.

steps.headline: Separate 5 eggs and put the yolks in a bowl.
steps.description: Crack 5 eggs and separate the yolks from the whites. Discard the whites or save them for another recipe. Then put the 5 yolks into a mixing bowl.Did You Know? If you want to use up a lot of egg whites, make meringues, pavlovas, macarons, and angel food cakes.

steps.headline: Whisk the juice, yolks, and sweetened condensed milk.
steps.description: Pour the lemon juice into the bowl with the egg yolks. Then open 2 14-ounce (396 g) cans of sweetened condensed milk and scoop them into the bowl. Whisk the ingredients until the mixture is smooth and combined. The sweetened condensed milk will sweeten the pie and help the filling set.

steps.headline: Spread the filling in the pie crust.
steps.description: Once the crust has cooled a little, pour the lemon filling into it. Use the back of a spoon or a spatula to spread the filling so it's level in the crust.

steps.headline: Bake the pie for 18 to 22 minutes.
steps.description: Put the pie into the oven that's still heated to 350 °F (177 °C) and bake the pie until the edges of the filling puff up a little. They should look set, although the center of the pie will still jiggle a little. The pie will finish setting up as it cools.

steps.headline: Remove the pie and chill it for at least 5 hours.
steps.description: Turn off the oven and take the pie out. Set it on a wire rack and leave it until it's at room temperature. Then cover the pie and put it in the refrigerator to cool completely.Tip: To make the pie in advance, bake it and cool it. Then refrigerate it overnight before topping it with whipped cream.

steps.headline: Whip the cream with powdered sugar and vanilla.
steps.description: Put 1 tablespoon (8 g) of powdered sugar and 1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of vanilla extract into a large mixing bowl. Pour in 1 cup (240 ml) of heavy whipping cream and use a stand or hand mixer to beat it on high. Keep beating until stiff peaks form. The cream will whip up faster if the beaters and mixing bowl are chilled first.

steps.headline: Spread or pipe the whipped cream over the pie before serving.
steps.description: Remove the chilled lemon pie from the refrigerator and spoon the whipped cream over the top. If you'd like a decorative look, put the whipped cream into a piping bag fitted with a star attachment. Then pipe swirls and stars over the pie. Slice and serve the pie while it's cold. Cover and refrigerate leftover lemon pie for up to 3 or 4 days. Keep in mind that the longer you store the pie, the more the whipped cream may weep.
